com.vaadin.contrib.gwtgraphics.client
Interface Strokeable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Circle, Ellipse, Line, Path, Rectangle, Shape, Text
public interface Strokeable

This interface must be implemented by VectorObjects that can be stroked.

Author:
Henri Kerola / IT Mill Ltd

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getStrokeColor()
          Returns the stroke color.
 double getStrokeOpacity()
          Returns the stroke opacity of the element.
 int getStrokeWidth()
          Returns the stroke width in pixels.
 void setStrokeColor(java.lang.String color)
          Sets stroke color.
 void setStrokeOpacity(double opacity)
          Sets the stroke opacity of the element.
 void setStrokeWidth(int width)
          Sets the stroke width in pixels.
 

Method Detail

getStrokeColor

java.lang.String getStrokeColor()
Returns the stroke color.

setStrokeColor

void setStrokeColor(java.lang.String color)
Sets stroke color. The color value is specified using one of the CSS2 color notations. For example, the following values are legal:
  • red
  • #ff0000
  • #f00
  • rgb(255, 0, 0)
  • rgb(100%, 0%, 0%)

Parameters:
color - the new stroke color
See Also:
http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/syndata.html#value-def-color

getStrokeWidth

int getStrokeWidth()
Returns the stroke width in pixels.

Returns:
the stroke width in pixels

setStrokeWidth

void setStrokeWidth(int width)
Sets the stroke width in pixels.

Parameters:
width - the stroke width in pixels

getStrokeOpacity

double getStrokeOpacity()
Returns the stroke opacity of the element.

Returns:
the current stroke opacity

setStrokeOpacity

void setStrokeOpacity(double opacity)
Sets the stroke opacity of the element. The initial value 1.0 means fully opaque stroke. On the other hand, value 0.0 means fully transparent paint.

Parameters:
opacity - the new stroke opacity
